name: Shakespeare's Tragedies and Dramas Quiz | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Shakespearean character is NOT one of the daughters of 'King Lear'?
questions.explanation:
Katharina.

	Katharina comes from 'Taming of the Shrew'.

questions.text: Of which character does Hamlet remark: 'Thou wretched, rash intruding fool'?
questions.explanation:
Polonius.

	Lots of people fare poorly in this one.

questions.text: Everyone knows that Brutus betrayed the title character in 'Julius Caesar'. What happened to Brutus at the end of the play?
questions.explanation:
He committed suicide.

	Murderers can't enjoy happy endings.

questions.text: Which character is NOT in 'The Tempest'?
questions.explanation:
Puck.

	Puck is from 'Midsummer Night's Dream'.

questions.text: In 'Romeo and Juliet', Romeo committs an act which leads to the beginning of the end when he kills this character.
questions.explanation:
Tybalt.

	We all know what happened afterwards.

questions.text: 'Othello' kills Desdemona because he believes that she has betrayed him with another man. Who is this 'other man'?
In 'Antony and Cleopatra', Antony meets defeat. Who is the victor?
questions.explanation:
Octavian.

	Octavian is also known as Octavius and as Augustus Caesar.

questions.text: In 'Macbeth', the murder of the king is the pivotal act about which the story revolves. Who is the king?
'Coriolanus' and 'Titus Andronicus' have one thing in common. They are both:
'Troilus and Cressida' uses what war as background?
questions.explanation:
Trojan War.

	Colorful characters from mythology abound.
